notes: NAMA refers  to a set of policies and actions that countries undertake as part of a commitment to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The term recognizes that different countries may take different nationally appropriate action on the basis of equity and in accordance with common but differentiated responsibilities and respective capabilities. It also emphasizes financial assistance from developed countries to developing countries to reduce emissions.
name: country-experience-on-nationally-appropriate-mitigation-action-nama

organization.description: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
organization.name: fao
organization.title: FAO

title: Country experience on Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Action (NAMA)

groups.title: Climate Change Mitigation
groups.name: climate-change-mitigation
groups.description: If the global food supply is to keep pace with population growth and dietary changes, agricultural productivity must increase. Changes in agricultural practices can help the world not only to meet its targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions but also to contribute to food security.

groups.name: climate-change-adaptation
groups.title: Climate change adaptation and resilience
groups.description: Climate change threatens our ability to ensure global food security, eradicate poverty and achieve sustainable development. Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from human activity and livestock are a significant driver of climate change, trapping heat in the earth's atmosphere and triggering global warming.

resources.name: Chad: support on NAMA elaboration
resources.description: December 2016, together with the Partnership for Transparency in the Paris agreement, FAO co-organized the Casablanca workshop of the Cluster Francophone on “Source of financing for NAMAs in the Energy and AFOLU sectors”. In that circumstance, Chad demanded support to FAO for improving the country capacity to elaborate NAMAs.

resources.name: Mozambique: support on NAMA elaboration
resources.description: FAO offered technical support to the workshop on capacity building and identification of potential NAMA organized by the Ministry in charge of land, environment and rural development (MITADER). The workshop was specifically requested by MITADER to the FAO Mozambique representation in 2016.
